rounds.response:
My hand (4♠ 3♠) missed the Q-high rainbow flop completely – no pair, no straight draw (would need 5,6), no flush draw. I have the absolute bottom of my range here.  
Opponent just called pre-flop out of position, so their range still contains many Q-x hands as well as overpairs, 8-x, 7-x, straight-draws, etc. – all of which dominate me.  
A bluff into Q-8-7 rainbow heads-up is unlikely to generate folds often enough, and I don’t want to build a big pot drawing dead.  
Therefore, the only viable line is to check back and hope for a cheap card or a surrender on the turn.

[Check]
